data.title: Lunch
data.text: Excellent food will recommend to anyone for Sushi in downtown. I will be back one of my favorite spots

data.title: Excellent Sushi, service, and nice atmosphere
data.text: We have been here a few times and also have at least good to excellent service.  The sushi is excellent quality but not necessarily ultra creative but that is okay as it is all delicious.  Service is great waitress very nice and pleasant.  We will be back.

data.title: Perfect  for lunch
data.text: My wife and I find Tsunami to be great every time we go, the consistency is wonderful. You always know the food is going to be excellent and I think that's what makes a great restaurant. Trisha always has a big smile welcoming you to the restaurant and that sets off a happy time. It's hard to eat sushi elsewhere when you know Tsunami is the best. You can always count on Tsunami to have outstanding Baked Mussels and the best tasting freshest sushi and sashimi in the Greenville, SC area.

data.title: Always good
data.text: We always pick Tsunami for sushi while in Greenville. The restaurant is cozy and relaxed, but fun and sophisticated at the same time. It's fun to go with friends and watch the football games and hang out. The drinks are great, the sushi is absolutely amazing. The wait staff is consistently good; attentive but not overbearing. I always get sushi but my husband does not like sushi; however there are plenty of options on the menu for him as well, and he just loves it. Will keep coming back again and again.

data.title: Great
data.text: Visited here with friends Labor Day weekend. We had Sushi & Filet Mignon hibachi. Both were great! The staff could be a little more friendly but maybe the weekend crowds wore them out. I recommend this place if you want Japanese & Sushi. I'll return next visit.

data.title: A night out with co-workers.
data.text: The sushi is amazing at Tsunami. Everything I've tried so far has been very good.The service was good. However, some of our party had wait longer for their meal.Over all we had a great time!

data.title: The best sushi in the area
data.text: My wife and I have been going to Tsunami for many years always had a great meal. Trisha the hostess always has a wonderful smile on her face and is very welcoming to us. The servers are great too and this time, Daphne M took care of us and she was delightful.As always we started with the best Baked Mussels in any sushi restaurant bar none. The spicy mayo is superior and they remove the mussel, cut it up and put it back in to cook, just outstanding. For lunch, they serve Bento Boxes and there are many to choose from all great. Then we shared the Red Dragan and Rockstar rolls both outstanding. tsunami is a great sushi restaurant .

data.title: Great food, great service, terrible hostess.
data.text: Food was amazing. The hostess was extremely rude to everyone who entered with and after us. Didn't really think she knew what she was doing. But the friendly server Kathryn made up for it all.

data.title: Best Sushi
data.text: I love this place for sushi! Service can be hit and miss but in my opinion the food makes up for it! Delicious special sushi rolls.

data.title: Our Favorite Tuna!
data.text: When my husband and I get the opportunity to sneak an unplanned dinner in, in downtown Greenville, we always choose Tsunami. They have a wide variety of sushi rolls and cooked items to choose from. We have tried a little bit of everything but our favorite is the Tsunami tuna trio and the tuna tar tar. I am pretty sure that we could eat it every day of the week if we had the chance. We dined at 6:45pm on a Wednesday. We had no wait and chose to sit at the sushi bar. I would recommend making reservations if you have a large party on the weekend. Enjoy!!

data.title: Excellent, Always Superior Sushi
data.text: We have always had excellent sushi and all that goes with it at Tsunami. Today was no different, our Miso Soup was hot and full of flavor, the Salad was excellent in size and dressing just very delicious. The Bento Tsunami Box had wonderfully thick pieces of Salmon and Tuna that melted in our months. The Baked Mussels set on cabbage with spicy real Japanese mayonnaise were just the best in the Upstate and beyond. Our Rainbow and Centipede Rolls were perfectly made and tasted wonderful. Trisha the manager welcomes you with a warm delightful smile that helps you to relax and enjoy your meal knowing everything is being done to satisfy you. If you want quality sushi Tsunami is where you should go.

data.title: just your average sushi place
data.text: I don't have anything bad to say about this place. they are just average. mediocre. never had anything bad, but never been blown away. i feel like I waste my money every time I go here.

data.title: Two great tips for 1
data.text:
1. Eat here it's great 
2. Take a sweater - it's freezing in here!

There's a great buzz in the place - service is great and food and drinks are super - parking is $5 across the street - prices are reasonable too.

Last tips?

Order a Moscow Mule! It's served in a cooper  mug and is full of vodka, ginger beer and over stuff - really helps to digest the salty Japanese food.

Ignore the hype on trip advisor re the mussels - as a fresh seafood loved trust me when I tell you yuk! Too much sauce - too rich -just not great - everything else was great though. But they need to warm the place up - it was freezing

data.title: Exquisite
data.text: Tsunami's never fails to impress! This is a smaller restaurant compared to others that I've eaten at. Waitstaff is friendly and fast and the food is excellent. The mixed drinks were a little off but that could explain the "bartender needed" sign posted outside. I will always keep going back to tsunami's its just good and I like it.

data.title: Best Sushi i have had in a long time
data.text: First time there.   Excellent sushi.   Excellent quality and presentation.  People were very friendly.  Very busy and a few walking blocks away from the Hyatt.    We did have a wait on a Friday night but to be expected.   Definitely worth the trip for both raw and cooked sushi as well as other items.  We will be back.  Enjoy!!!

data.title: Fabulous Sushi -  try the baked mussels
data.text:
Some of the best sushi I've eaten in years. Well presented and not too pricy. Would recommend poinsettia roll. 
Good bar as well if you have to wait fro a table.
Only drawback: the bill comes far too quickly, but that is unfortunately one of those things that happens regularly in american restaurants.

data.title: The best sushi in the Upstate
data.text: My wife and I have eaten at Tsunami many times and have always had the best sushi period. The Baked Mussels are the best of any restaurant bar none. We have tried them at other places, but none compares to what is served at Tsunami. Trisha the manager who is always very nice told us they only use Japanese mayo even though it costs more because the flavors can not be beaten. The sushi is always very fresh and prepared very well.  Some of the rolls we like are the Centipede and the Red Dragon and at lunch time, the Tsunami Bento Box is excellent. The servers are nice and helpful this visit Stephanie S took care of us.  If you want great sushi to try Tsunami.

data.title: First visit
data.text: I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Greenville. He had eaten here the previous month's trip. He knows I love sushi and brought me here. I can honestly say it's the best sushi I have ever had. I can't wait for the next trip that I get to go on.

data.title: Always a favorite of ours
data.text: We come here at least once a year for special occasions.  Recently it was my wife's birthday.  We usually order the spicy tuna and the palladian roll.

data.title: Love it!!
data.text: My Japanese family and I love this place. This is our go to place for sushi in Greenville. We do take out as well as eat in.
